A: 1. A person regarded as special for brave deeds is called a _______(a) Governor (b) Hero (c) President
2. _______________ is a popular dance among the Tiv people (a) Ekombi (b) Swange (c) Bata
3. Okun are the ______________ speaking group in Kogi state (a) Yoruba (b) Hausa (c) Efik
4. The Mumuye are also known as _____________(a) Okun (b) Gengle (c) Fulani
5. The Mumuye can be found in ____________ state (a) Adamawa (b) Taraba (c) Bauchi
6. In which town can Okun people mainly be found? (a) Kaaba (b) Lagos (c) Jalingo
7. The traditional occupation of Fulani men is _____________ (a) Farming (b) Cattle rearing (c) Fishing
8. _____________ is a cultural festival of the Ibibio (a) Egungun (b) New yam (c) Ekpe
9. The language spoken by the Igala is _______________(a) Efik (b) Igala (c) Hausa
10. The _____________ people can be found in towns like Oturkpo, Owukpa and Ogboju (a) Idoma (b) Igala (c) Fulani
11. The Kalabari people's favourite food includes ____________ and fisherman soup (a) Onunu (b) Isiewu (c) Afang
12. Who was the founder of Opobo kingdom? (a) King Jaja (b) Ladi Kwali (c) Oba Ovonramwen
13. A female hero is called _____________ (a) Heroine (b) Heroess (c) Herower
14. Who designed the Nigerian flag? (a) Pa Michael Taiwo Akinkunmi (b) Mary Williams (c) Mary's Lessor ssor
15. Jaja of Opobo was the leader of the ____________ (a) Opobo kingdom (b) Benin city (c) Abuja
16. Nigeria has many heroes and heroines who have made Nigeria proud through their contributions (a) True (b) False
17. The early heroes are dead while some of the modern heroes are still alive (a) True (b) False
18. Who died in 1891 on his way back from Britain where he was forcefully taken to? (a) Oba Ovonramwen (b) King Jaja (c) Pa Michael Taiwo Akinkunmi
B: 1.  A _____________ is a person regarded as special due to bravery.
2. The popular dance of the Tiv people is called _____________
3. The language spoken by the Okun people in Kogi State is _____________
4. Another name for the Mumuye people is _____________
5.  The Mumuye people are found in _____________ State.
6. _____________ is a town where Okun people predominantly reside.
7. _____________ is the traditional occupation of Fulani men.
8.  _____________ is a cultural festival celebrated by the Ibibio people.
9. The Igala people speak the _____________ language.
10. Oturkpo, Owukpa, and Ogboju are towns where _____________ people live.
11. _____________ and fisherman soup are favorite foods of the Kalabari people.
12. The founder of the Opobo kingdom was _____________
13. A female hero is referred to as a _____________
16. True or False: Nigeria has many heroes and heroines who have contributed to the nation's pride. _____________
17. True or False: Some modern-day heroes are still alive, while early heroes are deceased. _____________
18. _____________ died in 1891 while returning from forced exile in Britain
C: 1. Discuss the significance of recognizing and celebrating heroes and heroines in Nigeria.
2. Explain the impact of cultural festivals, such as the Ekpe festival of the Ibibio people, on preserving cultural heritage.
3. Analyze the role of traditional occupations, like cattle rearing among the Fulani, in shaping the economic and social structures of different communities in Nigeria.
4. Evaluate the historical significance of figures like Jaja of Opobo and their resistance against colonial rule in Nigeria.
